meanings.definition: A person who sells or promotes goods, especially in a persuasive or aggressive manner.
meanings.sent1: The puckster at the market convinced me to buy the fresh fruits.
meanings.sent2: The local puckster set up a stall to sell handmade crafts.
meanings.sent3: The puckster at the fair was so good at selling, he even convinced the clown to buy a hat!
meanings.sent4: She was a puckster of words, weaving tales that captivated her audience.
meanings.sent5: The puckster's voice boomed across the square, drawing in curious onlookers.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in the buying and selling of goods, especially in a clever or shrewd manner.
meanings.sent1: The puckster knew exactly when to buy and sell to make a profit.
meanings.sent2: In the bustling market, the puckster haggled skillfully with the vendors.
meanings.sent3: The puckster outsmarted the competition by selling ice to an Eskimo!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a puckster's playground, always strategizing the next deal.
meanings.sent5: The puckster's eyes gleamed with cunning as she closed another successful trade.
